field.name: ProfileName
field.label: Profile name
field.helptext: Enter the name of the profile (variable: profilename)

field.name: Mode
field.label: Mode
field.helptext: Scanning mode used by probe

field.name: Scanfile
field.label: File
field.helptext: File name to monitor or the command to execute in command mode

field.name: fileencoding
field.label: File encoding
field.helptext: The encoding of the file.

field.name: Check Interval
field.label: Check interval
field.helptext: Pick or enter the check interval. Valid input is "[number] [unit]" where unit can be either min (minutes) or sec (seconds).

field.name: QoS
field.label: Generate metrics
field.helptext: Enables the QoS messages for variables, which depends on the number of matches found.

field.name: Alarm
field.label: Generate alarms
field.helptext: Enables the alarm message for each matching expression of the watcher rule.

field.name: Missing File
field.label: Alarm on Missing or Open File
field.helptext: Check to enable the probe to generate an alarm when a log file to be monitored is a missing or open.

field.name: Clear on restart
field.label: Clear Alarms on Probe Restart
field.helptext: Select to clear alarms when the probe restarts.

field.name: WatcherName
field.label: Watcher name
field.helptext: Enter a unique watcher profile name (variable: watchername)

field.name: Patterntomatch
field.label: Pattern to match
field.helptext: Use pattern matching or regular expression

field.name: Level
field.label: Level
field.helptext: Select the severity level of the alarm to be created

field.name: Message
field.label: Message
field.helptext: Message to send when seding an alarm from this watcher, use $word1 to $word9 to parse the log message. You can also use $FILENAME for the monitored file. If left empty, the matched text will be used as the alarm message.

field.name: field501
field.label: Field separator
field.helptext:
<![CDATA[Define a character for separating fields in each record of the log file in the Field Separator field. Some of the field separator examples are as follows:
Space (the space character) means ‘white space’ (any space, for example, <return>, <tab>, <space>). The space is the default field separator. Ctrl + I indicates that <ctrl>+I (ASCII 9) is used as a field separator. Ctrl +A indicates that <ctrl>+A (ASCII 1) is used as a field separator. Ctrl + I + : indicates that both <tab> and colon (:) are used as field separators. First the record is divided into fields that is based on <tabs> found. Then, if a colon character (:) is found in a field (for example, time format hh:mm), this field is further divided. \\ indicates that the <backslash> character (\) is used as a field separator. Note: All variables are stripped of trailing whitespace after they are extracted, no matter how they are extracted. The leading whitespace is handled differently based on which mechanism is used, and which characters make up the separator list. ]]>

field.name: pathtopatternfile
field.label: Path to pattern file
field.helptext: Specifies the path of the file with the pattern strings to include in the expression.

field.name: tokenToBeReplaced
field.label: Token to be replaced
field.helptext: Replaces the specified text in the match expression with each string in the file and executes the rule.

field.name: expect_message (/profiles/AddOns/watchers/w1)
field.label: Message
field.helptext: Message to send on

field.name: pattern_threshold_severity (/profiles/AddOns/watchers/w1)
field.label: Severity
field.helptext: The severity of the alarm the probe sends when it runs a watcher rule.

field.name: pattern threshold
field.label: Threshold
field.helptext: Specify the number of pattern matches the probe detects before generating an alarm.

field.name: pattern_threshold_message (/profiles/AddOns/watchers/w1)
field.label: Message to Send
field.helptext: The severity of the alarm the probe sends when it runs a watcher rule.

field.name: profilename
field.label: Profile Name
field.helptext: Defines a name of the variable.

field.name: definitionCombo
field.label: Position
field.helptext: Select the method to extract the variable value.

field.name: sourcelineWorkable
field.label: Source line
field.helptext: Lets you define the starting line of the log file for extracting the variable value. This option is useful when a format rule is used. Note: This field is not used when the monitoring target is a URL.

field.name: start
field.label: Start
field.helptext: This field ignored for 'Match Expression' or 'Text Block'.

field.name: end
field.label: End
field.helptext: This field only used for 'Column to Column' or 'Character to Character'.

field.name: operator
field.label: Expected Value
field.helptext: Defines the operator and threshold value for the variable. The alarms are sent on match expressions for the watcher.

field.name: threshold
field.label: Threshold
field.helptext: If the threshold value is not breached, for any of the variables for watchers of the profile. The watcher does not generate an alarm even though the match expression is found.
